definition: to relax/to relax efforts/to slack off/to take it easy/complacent/undisciplined
loose/to loosen/to relax/floss (dry, fluffy food product made from shredded, seasoned meat or fish, used as a topping or filling)

sentences.english: With Victor’s guard down, Jack knocks him to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 由于维克多的戒心松懈，杰克将他击倒在地。

sentences.english: But he taps and strokes it until it finally relaxes and stretches.
sentences.chinese: 可他还是把这只海葵打到松懈下来才住手。

sentences.english: Lax security allowed the thieves to enter.
sentences.chinese: 松懈的保安措施使小偷有机可乘。

sentences.english: Grim situation, let superintend branch and certificate business grass-roots unit not dare a bit is lax.
sentences.chinese: 严重的形势，让监管部门和券商基层都不敢丝毫松懈。

sentences.english: Tom gives Mary a hug and she relaxes in his arms with a big sigh of relief.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆抱着玛莉，玛莉在他怀里松懈地大叹一声。

sentences.english: This year the employment situation will still be serious, and we cannot slacken our efforts in the slightest.
sentences.chinese: 今年就业形势依然严峻，工作上不能有丝毫松懈。

sentences.english: The students tend to fall away when there are no exams.
sentences.chinese: 没有考试学生们会松懈下来。
但是，暴风雪没有松懈下来的迹象。

sentences.english: "Let me be clear, we are not letting our guard down in Michigan in any way whatsoever," Gettelfinger said.
sentences.chinese: 说明白点，我们无论如何都不会在密歇根州有所松懈。

sentences.english: But his spirit was unstrung by his misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 但是他的精神并不因这种种不幸而松懈。

sentences.english: Tom gives Mary a hug and she relaxes in his arms with a sigh of relief.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆抱着玛莉，玛莉在他怀里松懈的大叹一声。

sentences.english: Tom gives Mary a hug and she relaxes in his arms with a sigh of  relief. She then says, "I love talking with you.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆抱着玛莉，玛莉在他怀里松懈的大叹一声。

sentences.english: Nokia got to the top of its industry quickly. Once there, it became complacent.
sentences.chinese: 诺基亚曾经很快地跨入业内顶尖行列，但却开始松懈。

sentences.english: But we slacked off, and they labored on.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我们松懈了，他们努力了。

sentences.english: There will be no loosening up until after the next leadership change in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 直到2012年下届领导人换届前，不会有任何松懈。

sentences.english: This also means calling his bluff and not letting him get away with slacking off.
sentences.chinese: 这也意味着接受挑战，并且别让他因为松懈而放弃。

definition: treat sth lightly/to lower one's guard
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
